events.originalText: The Israeli Air Force conducted missile strikes that hit multiple targets in western Syria, including one that accidentally downed a Russian plane.
events.subtitle: Israeli Air Force
events.headline: Israeli Air Force strikes hit multiple targets in western Syria, downing Russian plane

events.originalText: Adbusters, a Canadian anti-consumerist publication, organized a protest against corporate influence on democracy at Zuccotti Park in New York City that became known as Occupy Wall Street.
events.subtitle: Adbusters
events.headline: Adbusters organizes Occupy Wall Street protest at Zuccotti Park in New York City

events.originalText: Solidarity, a Polish trade union, was founded as the first independent labor union in an Eastern Bloc country.
events.subtitle: Solidarity (Polish trade union)
events.headline: Solidarity founded as first independent labor union in Eastern Bloc country

events.originalText: The Jordanian army entered Amman as part of operations to oust Palestinian fedayeen from the country in events later known as Black September (smoke over city pictured).
events.subtitle: Amman
events.headline: Jordanian army enters Amman to oust Palestinian fedayeen in Black September

events.originalText: NASA announced the Next Nine astronauts (pictured) selected for the purpose of landing on the moon.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA announces Next Nine astronauts for moon landing mission

events.originalText: Tintin in Tibet, the twentieth volume of The Adventures of Tintin by the Belgian cartoonist Hergé and which he regarded as his favourite in the series, began serialisation.
events.subtitle: Tintin in Tibet
events.headline: Tintin in Tibet begins serialisation by Belgian cartoonist Hergé

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Navy lost its first warship in the war when German submarine U-29 torpedoed and sank HMS Courageous.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal Navy loses first warship in WWII to German submarine U-29

events.originalText: World War II: The Soviet Union invaded Poland from the east, sixteen days after Nazi Germany's attack on the country from the west.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet Union invades Poland from east during WWII

events.originalText: Andrew Fisher, whose previous term as Prime Minister of Australia oversaw a period of reform unmatched in the Commonwealth until the 1940s, became prime minister for the third time.
events.subtitle: Andrew Fisher
events.headline: Andrew Fisher becomes Prime Minister of Australia for third time

events.originalText: The controversial Mormon bishop and prophetic dreamer John Hyrum Koyle began excavating the Dream Mine, which he believed would provide financial support to members of the LDS Church.
events.subtitle: John Hyrum Koyle
events.headline: Mormon bishop John Hyrum Koyle starts excavating Dream Mine

events.originalText: A British surveyor was detained by the Zulu on the border with the Colony of Natal; a demand for reparations for the incident formed part of an ultimatum that led to the Anglo-Zulu War.
events.subtitle: Natal–Zululand border incident
events.headline: British surveyor detained by Zulu border leads to Anglo-Zulu War

events.originalText: American Civil War: Almost 23,000 total casualties were suffered at the Battle of Antietam near Sharpsburg, Maryland, where Confederate and Union troops fought to a tactical stalemate.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Antietam sees 23,000 casualties in American Civil War

events.originalText: Disgruntled with the legal and political structures of the United States, Joshua Norton (pictured) distributed letters to various newspapers in San Francisco proclaiming himself to be Emperor Norton.
events.subtitle: San Francisco
events.headline: Joshua Norton proclaims himself Emperor Norton in San Francisco

events.originalText: Harriet Tubman (pictured) escaped from slavery in the U.S. state of Maryland, and later orchestrated the rescues of other slaves via the Underground Railroad.
events.subtitle: Harriet Tubman
events.headline: Harriet Tubman escapes slavery and leads others to freedom via Underground Railroad

events.originalText: War of the Pyrenees: Forces from the French Army of the Eastern Pyrenees defeated two divisions of the Army of Catalonia, ending the furthest Spanish encroachment in their invasion of Roussillon.
events.subtitle: War of the Pyrenees
events.headline: French Army defeats Spanish forces in War of the Pyrenees

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The Continental Army under Richard Montgomery began the Siege of Fort St. Jean in the British province of Quebec.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Continental Army begins Siege of Fort St. Jean in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Portuguese Restoration War: Having crossed the Minho and entered Portuguese territory, a Spanish army was victorious in the Battle of Vilanova.
events.subtitle: Portuguese Restoration War
events.headline: Spanish army victorious in Battle of Vilanova during Portuguese Restoration War

events.originalText: Puritan settlers from England founded the city of Boston in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, naming it after Boston, Lincolnshire, the origin of several prominent colonists.
events.subtitle: Puritans
events.headline: Puritan settlers found city of Boston in Massachusetts Bay Colony

events.originalText: Following the death of Louis I without a male heir, his daughter Mary was crowned with the title of King of Hungary.
events.subtitle: Louis I of Hungary
events.headline: Mary crowned King of Hungary after death of Louis I

events.originalText: Byzantine–Seljuk wars: Seljuq Turks prevented Byzantine forces from taking the interior of Anatolia at the Battle of Myriokephalon in Phrygia.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Seljuk wars
events.headline: Seljuq Turks prevent Byzantine forces from taking Anatolia at Battle of Myriokephalon
